cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/upper-Texas coast) early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Mississippi, greatest focus on Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Chance (≈1 in 4) of sustained 34-kt (40-45 mph) winds Tuesday with higher gusts; low (≈7%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the upper Texas coast if the center passes just east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 2–4 inches with locally higher totals, creating a flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and temporary channel/ICW closures possible.
